Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
about 20% have received refunds, but weighed to the smaller ones so only about $1 mil worth is returned. we are ahead of the June 15th schedule by almost a week. for those that did not receive refunds yet, make sure to follow the instructions. any address with any controversy has not been processed yet. i see a lot of people made many claims for the same address and that triggered a disputed flag, ie. delayed
all clean refunds for less than 7777 KMD has been processed
there will be daily batches
make sure the dust payment sent to your old address has 'S' in the explorer for your old address. if not, that means you did not send it to the new address. send all funds to the new address to solve this
if you did not get the early refund, that means you missed the cutoff yesterday, or made multiple claims or your address is contested or it is over 7777 KMD
plz do not be making DM asking about these things. it is always the same answer.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Vulnerabilities occur and unfortunately they are some times exploited by bad actors. However this is true of any piece of software.    Komodo has demonstrably made products and services that work, delayed proof of work, blockchain generator, various CC, atomic swap mechanism.   We will redouble our efforts and keep making new open source blockchain technology. (re @ethanwilliamg: How can anything else KMD team makes be ready if their native wallet wasnt ready?)

Content: [telegram] <ieatfeds> Hey so there is a copy/paste issue and typing the seed correctly has bugs, it prevents my last character from typing correctly inside the verus agama wallet on linux. happens consistently across two devices. I cannot generate the same kmd address. Are there any wallets that work so i can move my funds?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <ieatfeds> I've been trying for 45 minutes now, definitely is not user error or mistyping

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <ieatfeds> if there is an alternative wallet that I can use so i can save my funds, any help is appreciated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
Preferred:

- Verus Agama (https://github.com/VerusCoin/Agama/releases/tag/v0.6.0.13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview)
Windows - Agama-Windows-v0.6.0-13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview.zip
Mac - Agama-MacOS-v0.6.0-13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview.dmg
Linux - Agama-Linux-v0.6.0-13-PBaaS-Cross-chain-Technology-Preview.tar.gz
- KomodoOcean QT (https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/folders/29000055193)
- Ledger Hardware wallet (Make sure the Ledger seed hasn't been input in the above mentioned unsafe versions of Agama) 


Third Party wallets (Some of them are closed source, which is not ideal, but they can be used to move funds to a new address if necessary):



- Chameleon

    - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.chameleon.wallet

    - https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/chameleon-pay/id1453863654?ls=1&mt=8

- Magnum

    - https://magnumwallet.co/

- Pungo

    - https://pungo.app/

- Guarda

    - https://guarda.co/

- Zelcore

    - https://zel.network/project/zelcore/

- Coinomi

    - https://www.coinomi.com/en/
